approval_data.project_name: V-KYC recordings to be fetched for Audit requirements
approval_data.project_summary: To develop a portal/dashboard for VKYC Team Leads and Process Managers to efficiently access and download V-KYC recordings for audit and internal requirements, thereby replacing the current manual request process to the IT data server team.
project_goals: To fetch V-KYC recordings for audit and internal requirements efficiently.
Automate the retrieval process of V-KYC recordings.
Provide a user-friendly portal for VKYC leads to access recordings.
approval_data.business_context: Currently, the VKYC team relies on manual requests to the IT data server team to obtain VKYC recordings for internal and external audit purposes. These recordings are stored on an LTF NFS (Network File System) server. This manual process is inefficient and time-consuming. The project aims to streamline this by providing a self-service portal.

requirements.description: Access to the portal shall be provided to the leads of the VKYC process (Team Leaders & Process Managers).
All VKYC recordings shall be made available on this portal.
Recordings shall be fetched as and when required.
Recordings shall be searchable/filterable by date, month, and year.
Recordings shall be visible if searched by LAN ID.
An option for users to upload an Excel or text file will be available on the VKYC portal screen for bulk video download requests.
The uploaded file for bulk download shall allow employees to list a minimum of 2 and a maximum of 50 LAN IDs.
The uploaded file format for bulk download must be CSV or TXT.
Upon file upload, the system shall trigger a call to a backend API to process the bulk download request.
Upon receiving the response from the backend, the results shall be displayed on the screen in a tabular format.
The tabular display of bulk results shall be accompanied by a 'Download All' option.
The table pagination will display only 10 records at a time.
Only 10 records at a time will be downloaded via the bulk download option.
Post clicking a single LAN ID, the corresponding recording download shall start.

functional_requirements: Access to the portal shall be provided to the leads of the VKYC process (Team Leaders & Process Managers).
All VKYC recordings shall be made available on this portal.
Recordings shall be fetched as and when required.
Recordings shall be searchable/filterable by date, month, and year.
Recordings shall be visible if searched by LAN ID.
An option for users to upload an Excel or text file will be available on the VKYC portal screen for bulk video download requests.
The uploaded file for bulk download shall allow employees to list a minimum of 2 and a maximum of 50 LAN IDs.
The uploaded file format for bulk download must be CSV or TXT.
Upon file upload, the system shall trigger a call to a backend API to process the bulk download request.
Upon receiving the response from the backend, the results shall be displayed on the screen in a tabular format.
The tabular display of bulk results shall be accompanied by a 'Download All' option.
The table pagination will display only 10 records at a time.
Only 10 records at a time will be downloaded via the bulk download option.
Post clicking a single LAN ID, the corresponding recording download shall start.
non_functional_requirements: The portal access shall be restricted to very limited users (VKYC Team Leaders and Process Managers).
success_criteria: VKYC Team Leads and Process Managers can independently fetch V-KYC recordings without manual IT intervention.
Reduced reliance on the IT data server team for recording retrieval.
Efficient and timely access to V-KYC recordings for audit requirements.
constraints: Maximum 50 LAN IDs per bulk upload file.
Minimum 2 LAN IDs per bulk upload file.
Bulk upload file format must be CSV or TXT.
Table pagination displays only 10 records at a time.
Bulk download is limited to 10 records at a time.
assumptions: VKYC recordings are consistently available and accessible on the LTF NFS server.
A backend API exists or can be developed to process video retrieval requests from the NFS server.
The 'Approved PL-VKYC cases' data is accessible and accurate for mapping to recordings.
risks: Data security and potential unauthorized access to sensitive V-KYC recordings.
Performance issues with large volumes of recording data or concurrent bulk downloads.
Reliability and availability of the backend API and NFS server connectivity.
Accuracy of LAN ID mapping to the correct V-KYC recordings.
Scalability challenges if the volume of recordings or users increases significantly.

domain_specific_details.V-KYC: Video Know Your Customer process recordings, which are video calls conducted for customer identification.
domain_specific_details.LAN IDs: Unique identifiers for customer cases, used for searching and retrieving specific V-KYC recordings.
domain_specific_details.LTF NFS Server: Network File System server where VKYC recordings are currently stored and from which they need to be retrieved.
domain_specific_details.PL-VKYC cases: Refers to approved Personal Loan VKYC cases, indicating the scope of recordings to be managed.

recommendations: Elicit and document detailed Non-Functional Requirements (e.g., performance metrics, scalability, detailed security controls beyond access, reliability, error handling, logging, audit trails).
Clarify the exact purpose and usage of 'Date for cross checking the V-KKYC approved date (for IT usage)'.
Provide more detail on 'Business Test Scenarios' to ensure comprehensive testing coverage.
Confirm if 'Reporting Requirements: NA' is truly sufficient or if any audit-related reports or dashboards are needed from the portal itself.
Clarify the user experience and workflow for downloading more than 10 records when a bulk upload file can contain up to 50 LAN IDs.

identified_gaps: Lack of comprehensive Non-Functional Requirements (NFRs) such as performance benchmarks, scalability needs, detailed security measures (e.g., encryption, data retention), and robust error handling.
Ambiguity regarding the 'Date for cross checking the V-KKYC approved date (for IT usage)' – its purpose and how it impacts the system are unclear.
No explicit definition of error handling mechanisms or user feedback for various failure scenarios (e.g., invalid file format, LAN ID not found, API failures during bulk processing).
The user workflow for bulk downloads is partially defined: uploading up to 50 LAN IDs but only downloading 10 at a time. The process for downloading the remaining records is not specified.
Despite 'Reporting Requirements: NA', there might be implicit audit-related reporting or logging needs that are not captured.
No details on system integration beyond 'trigger a call to backend API'.
recommendations_for_completion: Conduct dedicated workshops with stakeholders to elicit and define detailed Non-Functional Requirements, including performance targets, security protocols, scalability plans, and disaster recovery.
Clarify the 'Date for cross checking the V-KKYC approved date (for IT usage)' requirement with the IT team to understand its functional implications.
Define comprehensive error handling strategies, including user notifications, logging mechanisms, and retry policies for failed operations.
Elaborate on the user experience for bulk downloads, specifically how users will manage downloading records beyond the initial 10-record limit from a larger uploaded file.
Re-evaluate reporting needs with audit and business teams to ensure no critical reports or audit trails are missed, even if 'NA' was initially stated.
Detail the integration points with the backend API and NFS server, including data formats, protocols, and security considerations.
